title: Wouldn't it be better if support & Adc to be in mid rather than bot?
body:
I was just thinking of warding potential, early farm, better travel for large monsters and easier on jungler after clearing.
what are your guys thoughts? Would love to hear some opinions on lane changing.

replies.body: The meta, (as far as I'm aware) is based on how the top 3 regions play. LPL, NA, EU and so on. I don't know if the teams or the analysts themselves have done stats and numbers to confirm if this is the best way to play the game but I do know the rest of the world follows their lead. This does not in my opinion, mean as an independent team that you should follow the meta but unless you have a solid working strategy with a team of you're own then statistically you will be hard pressed to find success any other way.

generally if you want to see purely what "works" you look at what they do in korea. If they change bot and mid in korea; then I'd advise you do the same. Otherwise it's probably not efficient.

 Also midlane is designed to be the shortest lane; hence champions that need to snowball and roam alot are best placed here since they can roam the map easier from the center and get back in lane faster after recalling. The adc however needs to farm up more than get kills and roam since they are all about items and lategame. The open sides encourage either mobility or range and cc since ganks from the jungle can be devastating. Due to this battle mages and assassins tend to fare better in midlane. Bot lane is the most appropriate lane for dragon control since they are furthest from the bruisers of toplane and can afford the time out of lane due to it's length with less risk of their opposing laner turning up uninvited after they force a back. Thus the combo that can take the dragon fastest and safest with least damage, the adc, jg and sup is best suited for dragon control.

Considering the tower changes I think the duo will forced to stay bot. 

>* Fortificationâ€™s damage reduction no longer applies to bottom lane turrets 
* In addition to normal rewards, the first turret killed yields 400 total bonus gold to its killer's team

Since the bot tower is the "easiest" way to get that bonus gold it'll put a greater importance on protecting it. For the same reason, it will be unlikely we see lane swaps to either top or mid as the tower is harder to bring down in a race against someone pushing bot.

If they were mid it would be easier to gank them from either side whereas there's only one side a jungler can come in from and you just keep it warded. Of course this isn't SUCH a big deal and could work I suppose but you'd need more wards to keep mid full of vision.
